== Main Inclusion Report for tracker ==

=== Requirements ===

 0. ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/t/tracker/ ; available for all supported architectures

 0. ''Rationale:''
** Provide a smaller memory footprint desktop search tool, without mono dependencies.
** Make possible the integration with nautilus search

 0. ''Security:''
** No CVE entries for tracker <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=tracker]]</nowiki>.
** No entries for tracker <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=tracker|Secunia history]]</nowiki>.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** Does not open any port.
** Shallow security review by MartinPitt: not a 100% proof against int/buffer overflows, but I did not find any actual vulnerabilities (with the standard grepping/eyeballing a sample method)
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** See <nowiki>[[http://bugzilla.gnome.org/browse.cgi?product=tracker|Tracker bugs]]</nowiki>
** See <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/pkgreport.cgi?src=tracker|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>
** See <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/tracker/|Ubuntu bugs]]</nowiki>
** Does not deal with exotic hardware which we cannot support.

 0. ''Standards compliance:''
** Meets <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki>
** Implements the freedesktop specification for metadata (http://freedesktop.org/wiki/Standards/shared-filemetadata-spec).

 0. ''Dependencies:''
** All in Main

=== Reviewers ===
MartinPitt: approved
